sen.j: 大日本茶道学会（だいにほんちゃどうがっかい）は、茶道の流派の一つ。
sen.e: Dainihon Chado Gakkai is one of the schools of the tea ceremony.
Dainihon Chado Gakkai is one of the schools of the tea ceremony.
Dainihon Chado Gakkai is one of the schools of the tea ceremony.

sen.j: 運営の主体は財団法人三徳庵であり、東京都新宿区左門町にある。
sen.e: The management body is the Santokuan foundation located in Samon-cho, Shinjuku Ward, Tokyo.
The management body is the Santokuan foundation located in Samon-cho, Shinjuku Ward, Tokyo.
The management body is the Santokuan foundation located in Samon-cho, Shinjuku Ward, Tokyo.

sen.j: 「秘伝開放」「茶道本来無流儀」を掲げ、近代茶道の復興を目指した。
sen.e: They aimed the revival of modern tea ceremony with slogans of "disclosing the secrets" and "the theory of the origin of the tea ceremony".
They aimed the revival of modern tea ceremony with slogans of "disclosing the secrets" and "the theory of the origin of the tea ceremony."
They aimed the revival of modern tea ceremony with slogans of "disclosing the secrets" and "the tea ceremony free from schools in essential."
sen.cmt: 「茶道本来無流儀」の「無」の意味を訳出しました。ご確認ください。

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）裏千家13代圓能斎の門人であった田中仙樵の提唱により、京都高台寺に創立された。
sen.e: The association was founded in 1898, in Kyoto Kodai-ji temple, Kyoto by advocacy of Sensho TANAKA who was a disciple of Ennosai, the13th generation of Urasenke.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The association was founded in 1898, in Kyoto Kodai-ji temple, Kyoto by advocacy of Sensho TANAKA who was a disciple of Ennosai, the13th generation of Urasenke.
The association was founded in 1898, in Kyoto Kodai-ji temple, Kyoto by advocacy of Sensho TANAKA who was a disciple of Ennosai, the13th generation of Urasenke.

sen.j: 初代会長は鳥尾小弥太。
sen.e: The first president was Koyata TORIO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The first president was Koyata TORIO.
The first president was Koyata TORIO.

sen.j: しかしわずか3年後の1901年に解散。
sen.e: However, it dismissed in 1901 only three years after the foundation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, he was dismissed in 1901 only three years after the foundation.
However, the association was dismissed in 1901 only three years after the foundation.

sen.j: 田中仙樵は石州流清水派の野崎兎園に入門して南方録墨引巻にある曲尺割（かねわり）の研究に取り組む。
sen.e: Sensho TANAKA became a pupil of Shimizu-ha group of Sekishu school Toen NOZAKI and send his time studying kanewari (one theory of tea ceremony) of Namporoku Sumibiki kan (Sumibiki volume of Namporoku).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Sensho TANAKA became a pupil of the Shimizu-ha group of the Sekishu school Toen NOZAKI and spent his time studying kanewari (one theory of tea ceremony) of Namporoku Sumibiki kan (Sumibiki volume of Namporoku).

Sensho TANAKA became a pupil of the Shimizu-ha group of the Sekishu school Toen NOZAKI and spent his time studying kanewari (one theory of tea ceremony) of Namporoku Sumibiki kan (Sumibiki volume of Namporoku).

sen.j: 鳥尾小弥太の没後1910年になってから、小弥太の夫人である鳥尾泰子を第2代会長に迎えて東京市浅草区に再興される。
sen.e: In 1910, after its death of Koyata TORIO, it was reestablished in Asakusa Ward, Tokyo, with the second president Yasuko TORIO who was Koyata's wife.
In 1910, after its death of Koyata TORIO, it was re-established in Asakusa Ward, Tokyo, with the second president Yasuko TORIO who was Koyata's wife.
In 1910, after the death of Koyata TORIO, it was re-established in Asakusa Ward, Tokyo, with the second president Yasuko TORIO who was Koyata's wife.

sen.j: 本部は移転を数回繰り返し、田中仙樵が1930年に第3代会長に就任した後、1938年に現在地に移転した。
sen.e: The headquarters has moved several times, and after Sensho TANAKA became the third president in 1930, it relocated to the present location in 1938.
The headquarters has moved several times, and after Sensho TANAKA became the third president in 1930, it relocated to the present location in 1938.
